snippet: An elections panel on Monday affirmed the candidacy of the opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi for Parliament.
abstract: United States waives some sanctions against Myanmar, allowing the Myanmar government to work with the World Bank and other international financial organizations to bolster its economy; decision is the latest in a series of cautious reciprocal steps intended to reward sweeping political and economic changes in the country; elections commission affirms the candidacy of the opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi for Parliament.
lead_paragraph: An elections panel on Monday affirmed the candidacy of the opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi for Parliament.

headline.seo: Myanmar: Panel Approves Aung San Suu Kyi’s Run for Parliament
headline.main: Myanmar: Government Panel Approves Opposition Leader’s Run for Parliament
headline.print_headline: Myanmar: In Effort to Aid Economy, U.S. Lifts Some Travel Sanctions
